newsitem.title: UK: Amstrad up on disposal news, buyback talk.
newsitem.headline: Amstrad up on disposal news, buyback talk.

text.p: Shares in Amstrad Plc were up 7-1/2p to 207-1/2p by 0750 GMT after the consumer electronics group said it had entered into a conditional agreement to sell its Dancall Telecom mobile telephone business for 92 million stg.
The company also said it was considering proposals to "return value' to shareholders.
""A share buyback would be one possibility which is what is in the minds of a few people this morning,'' one market maker said.
Amstrad said in a statement that it would look at proposals to return value to shareholders through a tax efficient mechanism.
Pending that, the proceeds from the Dancall disposal would be added to the company's existing cash balances.
